When a CGI script is invoked (with additionalfrom mod_include, the setting of the CGI variable SCRIPT_NAME is incorrect. For a normal CGI program, SCRIPT_NAME will be the URL part which map to the script, and PATH_INFO will contain any extra path information. When invoked from mod_include virtual include, the PATH_INFO is not removed from SCRIPT_NAME. According to the CGI standard, the script name is "virtual path to the script being executed, used for self-referencing URL". Test Case: The 'simple.cgi' is the "printenv" script. Invoking: /~yair/xtest/code/simple.cgi/params, Result: SCRIPT_NAME=/~yair/xtest/code/simple.cgi Invoking: the same URL from mod_include Result: SCRIPT_NAME=/~yair/xtest/code/simple.cgi/params As a side comment, I tested the same script using mod_perl, and got the same results.
